question: Gotquestions?
answer: Our dedicated support team ishere 24/7 to help.

question:
How can I apply for the Edge+
            CSB Bank RuPay Credit Card?
answer:
You can check your eligibility and credit limit for the credit card instantly. To apply for the card,
            download the Jupiter app and complete your application anytime. It’s 100% digital with no paperwork!

question:
What's the maximum cashback I
            can earn with Edge+?
answer:
There is no maximum limit of cashback which can be earned with Edge+, there are limits on accelerated
            cashback for categories.

question:
What is the maximum cashback I
            can earn for each category?
answer:
The maximum cashback applicable under each category is: 10% cashback - ₹1,500 per billing cycle (merchant
            limit of ₹500) 5% cashback - ₹1,000 per billing cycle 1% cashback - No Limit

question: How is cashback credited?
answer:
The cashback amount is credited to your account instantly in the form of Jewels. 5 Jewels = ₹1 and you can
            redeem Jewels as cash, gift cards, Digital Gold, and for bill payments.

question: Which brands does Edge+ offer cashback on?
answer:
10% cashback on shopping: Amazon, Flipkart, Myntra, Ajio, Zara, Nykaa, Croma, Reliance Trends, Tata Cliq,
            Reliance Digital 5% cashback on travel: MakeMyTrip, EaseMyTrip, Yatra, Cleartrip 1% cashback: On all other
            offline & online eligible spends. Please note that we display third-party brand logos only to indicate where
            cashback is applicable, and it does not amount to any endorsement by either party. All trademarks belong to
            their respective owners. The brands are subject to change.

question: Are there any fees for the Edge+ card?
answer:
There is only a one-time joining fee of ₹499+GST for the card. You also get a Fraud Protection Plan by
            OneAssist which includes an Amazon Prime Membership worth ₹1499. The card is lifetime free with no annual
            fee.

question:
What is the Jupiter All-in-1
            Savings Account?
answer:
The All-in-1 Savings Account on Jupiter powered by Federal Bank helps you manage your money better with
            faster payments, smart saving tools, and investment insights—all in one place.

question:
How do I open a Jupiter Savings
            Account?
answer: You can open your Jupiter digital account by following a few simple steps:Install the Jupiter appTap ‘Open an all-in-1 Savings Account’ while selecting a Jupiter experienceComplete your video KYC

question:
Do I earn Jewels for making
            payments?
answer: Yes! You earn up to 1% cashback as Jewels on:UPI paymentsDebit Card spends (online & offline)Investments in Digital Gold

question:
Can I use my Jupiter Debit Card
            outside India?
answer:
Absolutely. You can spend in over 120 countries with 0% forex fee on international transactions using your
            Jupiter Debit Card.

question:
Do I earn Jewels on
            International payments?
answer: Yes, you also earn up to 1% cashback on online and offline international spends.

question:
What payment modes are available
            with the Jupiter account?
answer:
You can make superfast payments with UPI, IMPS, and debit card—whether it's for recharges, bills, or
            merchant transactions

question:
Can I invest using my Jupiter
            account?
answer:
Yes! You can invest in Mutual Funds and Digital Gold with up to 1.5% extra returns on curated mutual fund
            plans.

question: What additional benefits do I get with the Savings Account?
answer: Yes! You earn up to 1% cashback as Jewels on:Free cheque bookFree IMPS transfersATM withdrawals

question:
How is this Salary account
            different then?
answer:
Our Salary Account can also be opened by an employee and does not necessarily need an employer to open one
            for you.

question:
Why should I switch to Salary
            account?
answer:
It’s your Salary Account with extra benefits. Get the most out of your salary. Salary account is an upgraded
            version of the Basic account. Receive your monthly salary in your new Salary Account to earn maximum rewards
            on Jupiter, free credit & debit card, Mini Loans starting from 0% interest.

question: How do I open a Salary account?
answer:
To open a Salary account, follow these easy steps: 1. Download the Jupiter app and create your account 2.
            Complete your video verification / full KYC 3. Submit your company's name and verify your work email address
            4. Share your new account details with HR and make sure to get your next salary in your new Salary Account
            within 60 days. That's it! Once your salary is credited, you'll automatically be upgraded to a Salary
            account.

question: already have a Savings Account on the Jupiter app. How do I upgrade to a Salary account?
answer:
To upgrade to a Salary account, please go to 'Settings' on the Jupiter app and follow 3 simple steps.
            Currently open to select few.

question:
Who all can open a Salary
            account on Jupiter?
answer:
To open a Salary account, please ensure that your in-hand salary is more ₹20,000. However, this is
            negotiable for teams. Please connect with us to learn more about the Salary account.

question:
How much time does it take to
            open a Salary account?
answer: It takes only 3 minutes to complete all the steps to open a Salary account.

question:
Can I change my already existing
            salary account? How?
answer:
Create a new account on the app, submit your new bank account details with your HR to receive further
            salaries in that account and turn yourself into a Salary Account user

question:
Are there any charges for
            opening a Salary account?
answer:
Opening a Salary Account on Jupiter is completely free. There are also no charges for UPI, NEFT, and RTGS
            transactions.

question: What is Mini-Loan?
answer:
By opening a Salary account, you can instantly withdraw your partial salary before salary day with no
            interest charges.

question:
I'm a non-salaried individual.
            How do I upgrade to Salary account?
answer:
Keep an eye out – we'll bring the benefits of Salary account to freelancers & other non-salaried individuals
            soon.

question:
Which documents are required for
            opening a Salary account?
answer: Your Aadhaar card linked with your phone number and PAN card are required to open a Salary account.

question:
How much does the Corporate
            Salary Account cost?
answer: It's completely free.

question:
What if my company already has
            salary accounts for employees with another bank?
answer:
If you have an existing account with another bank, you can continue using it for business banking. You can
            still use Jupiter Corporate Salary Account for your employees with discounted medical insurance, 0% interest
            loans, 0 forex fees, and more. Ultimately, you get the best of both worlds.

question: Is my employee’s money safe?
answer:
It is 100% safe. Jupiter Corporate Salary Account is hosted in an RBI-licensed bank (Federal Bank) and the
            money in the account is insured up to ₹5,00,000.

question: Does my company need a minimum number of employees?
answer: We support companies of all sizes. From 2-person businesses to organizations that have over 1000 employees.

question:
What is the benefit for my
            company?
answer:
Jupiter Corporate Salary Account helps you save up to ₹50,00,000 yearly by cutting down on HRMS costs,
            payroll software costs and health insurance costs.You can streamline payout processes with our bulk salary payout portalYour employees can also get loans at 0% interest, and invest in Mutual Funds and Digital Gold on Jupiter

question:
Which documents are needed for
            opening a Salary Account?
answer: Your employees need to have the following to open a Jupiter Corporate Salary AccountPhysical PAN cardA smart phoneMobile number linked to Aadhar cardPAN & Aadhaar should be linked

question:
What is the initial deposit when
            you open a Salary Account?
answer: No initial deposit is required to open a Salary Account.

question:
Do we need to shift our Current
            Account to Jupiter?
answer:
Absolutely not, your existing relationship with banker is mostly for Business Banking. You shall continue
            enjoying benefits provided by your existing banker (for business banking) + enjoy additional benefits from
            Jupiter against your employee’s bank account. You get to enjoy the best of both worlds.

question:
Do employees need to maintain
            any minimum balance?
answer:
While users are required to maintain ₹5,000 as the average monthly balance, charges up to ₹200 for not
            maintaining of balance. However for Salary Account users, the account is a zero balance account on
            consistent salary credits.

question:
Is it a Federal bank account or
            Jupiter account?
answer:
A Federal Bank account is created for each employee. They can use the Jupiter app to pay, invest or save
            money without any restrictions.

question:
Can the employee continue with
            the Jupiter salary account even if he leaves the present company?
answer:
Your employees can continue using the same Salary Account with their new employer and keep enjoying our
            benefits.

question:
If any employee has an active
            loan with their current bank, can they still use the Jupiter Corporate Salary Account?
answer:
They can continue paying their loan with their existing bank. Jupiter's Autopay feature lets them
            auto-transfer any amount from their Jupiter account to their existing bank, ensuring their loan payments
            continue seamlessly.

question: What payment methods does Jupiter support?
answer:
You can make payments via UPI, your linked bank account, and debit cards. You can also link any bank’s RuPay
            Credit Card to Jupiter UPI and make payments.

question:
Is it safe to make payments
            through Jupiter?
answer:
Yes. Jupiter uses industry-standard encryption and is compliant with RBI regulations to ensure secure and
            private transactions.

question: Can I pay my bills using Jupiter?
answer:
Yes, you can pay utility bills like electricity, gas, DTH, water, and mobile recharges directly from the
            app.

question: Can I link multiple bank accounts to Jupiter?
answer: Yes, you can link more than one bank account and switch between them when making UPI payments.

question: Can I track my payments on Jupiter?
answer:
Yes, you can track all your payments, see your top spending categories, and get actionable insights to
            better manage your money.

question: How do I earn cashback or rewards on payments?
answer:
If you have a PRO Savings Account, you earn 1% cashback on all Debit Card payments and UPI payments from 7
            top brands. If you have linked any RuPay Credit Card to Jupiter UPI, you earn up to 2% cashback on every
            payment. Cashback is credited in the form of Jewels. 5 Jewels = ₹1

question: Are there any charges for UPI transactions?
answer: No, UPI payments are free of charge on Jupiter.

question: Is there a transaction limit for UPI payments?
answer: Yes, the daily UPI limit is set by your bank and NPCI, which is generally ₹1 Lakh per day.

question: What types of bills can I pay on Jupiter?
answer:
You can pay your credit card bills, electricity, DTH, broadband, water, gas, mobile prepaid, and more—all in
            one place.

question: What payment modes can I use to pay bills on Jupiter?
answer:
You can pay bills through bank transfers linked to your Federal Bank Savings Account, UPI, or your RuPay
            Credit Cards.

question: Do I get rewards for bill payments?
answer: Yes! You earn Jewels for every eligible bill and recharge made with Jupiter.

question: What are Jewels and how do they work?
answer:
Jewels are credits you earn when you make eligible payments with Jupiter. You can redeem them in cash for
            instant discounts on future bill payments.₹1= 5 Points**As per the rewards policy

question: How do I activate Autopay?
answer:
To set up Autopay for bills & recharges, use your Jupiter UPI ID as a default payment method on the
            respective merchant app or website.

question: Do I need to upload any documents or enter bill details manually each time?
answer: No paperwork needed! Just link your billing merchant once, and your dues automatically in the future.

question: Can I track my past payments?
answer: Yes, your entire payment history is available under the ‘Bills & Recharges’ section in the app.

question: What type of payments can I make with Jupiter UPI?
answer: You can send money, pay contacts, scan QR codes at stores, and shop online—securely and instantly.

question: Do I need to open a Jupiter Savings Account to use UPI?
answer: No, you can use Jupiter UPI with your existing bank account by linking it on the Jupiter app.

question: What rewards do I get with my Edge CSB Bank RuPay Credit Card?
answer: You can get 2% cashback on UPI & credit card spends with the Edge CSB Bank RuPay Credit Card.

question: Can I send money to contacts using other UPI apps?
answer: Absolutely. Jupiter lets you send money to anyone—regardless of the UPI app they use.

question: What is UPI Lite and how does it work?
answer:
UPI Lite lets you make small-value payments without entering your UPI PIN (Up to ₹5,000). It’s perfect for
            quick spends like groceries or tea.

question: Is there a limit on UPI transactions?
answer: To ensure safety of your transactions, NPCI has set the maximum daily UPI payments limit to ₹1 Lakh.

question: What is Magic Spends and how does it work?
answer:
Magic Spends is an exclusive feature on Jupiter to automatically invest every time you spend. You can select
            any amount, set a monthly limit, and invest in either Mutual Funds or Digital Gold with every UPI, Debit
            Card, and Credit Card payment.

question:
Where can I invest with Magic
            Spends?
answer: You can invest in a Mutual Fund of your choice or 24K Digital Gold every time you spend.

question: Can I customize how much money I auto-invest every time I spend?
answer:
Yes, you can auto-invest ₹10 or more in Digital Gold or ₹100 or more in Mutual Funds every time you spend
            with Magic Spends.

question: Can I track my invested amount with Magic Spends?
answer: Yes, you can track the value of your invested amount in real-time for both Mutual Funds and Digital Gold.

question: What happens if I don’t have enough balance in my account?
answer:
If you don’t have enough balance while spending, Magic Spends will be skipped. You can continue
            auto-investing after you add money to your account.

question: Can I pause Magic Spends or withdraw my invested amount?
answer:
Yes, you can pause Magic Spends anytime through the app. You can also withdraw the money you’ve invested and
            it will be credited instantly to your account.

question: Are there any fees or charges for Magic Spends?
answer: No, Magic Spends is completely free to set up and Jupiter does not charge any commissions.

question: What can I do in the Money tab on Jupiter?
answer:
You can track your income, expenses, top categories, upcoming bills, and get smart insights on where your
            money goes — all in one place.

question:
How does Jupiter categorize my
            spending?
answer:
Jupiter auto-categorizes your transactions (like groceries, food, shopping, etc.) using smart tags so you
            can understand your spending patterns at a glance.

question: Can I track my credit card expenses in the Money tab?
answer:
Yes, you can link your credit cards and view all your spends, dues, and statements in one place, even if
            they’re from other banks.

question: What is Account Aggregator and how does it work?
answer:
Account Aggregator (AA) is a secure framework regulated by the RBI that lets you link and track balances and
            payments from all your bank accounts. Rest assured, you stay in control and choose what to share and for how
            long.

question: Is it safe to link my accounts through Account Aggregator?
answer:
Yes, it’s completely safe. Jupiter only accesses your data with your consent via licensed Account
            Aggregators like Finvu, and cannot access it without your permission.

question: Can I set Budgets in the Money tab?
answer:
Yes, you can set a monthly Budgets to control overspending and manage your money better every month. Jupiter
            lets you know when you’re about to cross your monthly Budget so you can plan your expenses better!

question: What is Net Worth in Jupiter and how is it calculated?
answer:
Your Net Worth on Jupiter is the difference between what you own and what you owe. It includes all your
            linked bank balances, investments (like FDs or mutual funds), and credit card dues or loans. When you link
            external accounts using Account Aggregator, we give you a real-time, 360° view of your true net worth in one
            simple number.

question:
What types of loans can I get on
            Jupiter?
answer: You can choose from the following loan options:Personal Loan -Up to ₹5,00,000Mini Loan -Up to ₹1,00,000Loan against Mutual Funds -Up to ₹50,00,000

question: Who can apply for a Personal Loan on Jupiter?
answer: To apply for a Personal Loan, you must:Be an Indian residentBe 21 to 60 years oldBe either salaried, business owner, or self-employed

question:
What are the interest rates
            applicable on loans with Jupiter?
answer: Personal Loans start at 1.33% per monthMini Loans have 0% interest (If repaid in 45 days)Loans against Mutual Funds start at 10.5% per annum

question:
Is the loan application process
            fully digital?
answer: Yes, the entire process, from checking eligibility to receiving funds, is 100% digital on the Jupiter app.

question:
How do I apply for a loan on
            Jupiter?
answer: Check your eligibilitySelect your preferred loan optionConfirm the loan detailsGet money instantly in your account

question:
Will I get reminders for my EMI
            payments?
answer: Yes, Jupiter sends timely EMI reminders so you never miss a due date.

question: Is there any support if I face issues?
answer: Yes, you get 24x7 support from our team via the Jupiter app.

question: What can I use my loan for?
answer: The loans are flexible and can be used for any purpose, including:Laptop or phone purchaseMedical expensesTravel, wedding, or home renovationDebt consolidation or emergencies

question: What is a loan against mutual funds?
answer:
A Loan Against Mutual Funds lets you borrow money by pledging your Mutual Funds. On Jupiter, you can get a
            Loan Against Mutual Funds of up to ₹2 Crore.

question: How much money can I borrow?
answer: Your loan limit will depend on the amount and type of Mutual Funds in your portfolio.

question: Can I choose any date for my monthly loan repayment?
answer: You can repay the principal amount anytime within 36 months and the interest in 12 EMIs

question: Do I need to pay interest on the whole amount I am eligible for?
answer: No, you pay monthly interest only on the withdrawn amount out of the total credit limit given to you.

question: What is lien marking/pledging of Mutual Funds?
answer:
When you take a Loan Against Mutual Funds, your funds will be lien marked. This means, the lender has the
            right to hold your units and sell them in case the loan isn't repaid. However, your funds will continue
            earning returns and will be redeemable once the loan is fully repaid.

question: Which mutual fund schemes are accepted or can be pledged to take loans?
answer:
Your loan limit can be up to 75% of the Net Asset Value (NAV) of your Debt Mutual Funds, and 45% of the NAV
            of Equity Mutual Funds. For example, if you have invested ₹3 Lakh in Debt Mutual Funds and ₹1 Lakh in Equity
            Mutual Funds, your available loan limit will be(75% of ₹3 Lakhs) + (45% of ₹1 Lakh) = ₹2.70 Lakh

question: How do I check my limit?
answer: You can check your limit on the Jupiter app

question: Can I pledge any Mutual Fund?
answer: Yes, you can pledge any eligible Mutual Fund. You can also choose the number of units you want to pledge.

question: When can I redeem the Mutual Funds I have pledged?
answer: Your Mutual Funds will be redeemable once your loan is fully repaid

question: What is the tenure of the loan against mutual funds?
answer: You can repay the principal amount in up to 36 months and the interest in 12 EMIs

question: What is the credit limit and how is it calculated?
answer:
Your credit limit is calculated based on the value of your Mutual Funds portfolio Link to doc: LAMF Landing
            Page & SEO Requirements

question:
What investment options are
            available on Jupiter?
answer: You can invest in the following:Mutual FundsDigital GoldMagic SpendsFixed Deposits

question:
Do I need to open a Savings
            Account to Invest on Jupiter?
answer:
Yes, you need to open a Savings Account to invest in Mutual Funds, Magic Spends or Fixed Deposits. But, you
            can start investing in Digital Gold even without opening a Savings Account.

question:
Is there a fee for investing in
            Mutual Funds on Jupiter?
answer: No, Jupiter doesn't charge any commissions or extra fees on Mutual Funds

question: How do No-Penalty SIPs work on Jupiter ?
answer: No-Penalty SIPs let you skip SIPs without having to pay any extra charges

question: What is ‘Magic Spends’ and how does it work?
answer:
Magic Spends lets you auto-invest small amounts (like ₹10 or more) every time you spend, turning your daily
            spending into effortless investing.

question: Can I withdraw from Fixed Deposits before maturity?
answer: Yes, FlexiFD lets you withdraw money in parts without having to break your full FD.

question: Is my money safe when I invest on Jupiter?
answer:
Yes. Jupiter partners with trusted AMCs, RBI-regulated entities, and SEBI-compliant platforms to ensure your
            investments are 100% safe.

question: Am I eligible to invest on Jupiter?
answer:
We're currently open to folks who have Mutual Fund investment accounts already. If you've invested in Mutual
            Funds in India, or have signed up to invest on another platform before, you're eligible! Go ahead and sign
            up on the Jupiter app to get started. In a few weeks, everyone else will also be able to invest on Jupiter —
            hang in there, and watch this space for updates

question: How do I pay less and earn more using the Jupiter App?
answer:
On Jupiter, you pay less and earn more on your investments because:Jupiter doesn’t charge any hidden commissions of 1.5% over and above your investment
                amount like other regular funds.Jupiter doesn’t charge Penalties of up to Rs 750 that other banks charge in case you miss
                a SIP because of insufficient balance in your account

question: What’s the difference between a No-Penalty SIP and a Normal SIP?
answer:
In case you miss a SIP because of insufficient balance in your account, your bank charges you ₹250–₹750 as
            Penalty for that missed SIP. Jupiter just smartly skips your SIP! So, there are no Penalty charges

question: What all Mutual Funds does Jupiter have?
answer:
Jupiter has 1000+ Mutual Funds from 39 major AMCs across India. Jupiter only provides growth Direct Mutual
            Funds which are the best commission-free funds in India

question: What are Mutual Funds?
answer:
Mutual fund is an investment vehicle that brings together money from many people like you and invests it in
            stocks, bonds or other assets.Example: ICICI Prudential Technology Fund invests your money, majorly in high growth technology companies
            like Infosys, Wipro, HCL Technologies,etc.

question: Why should I invest with Jupiter Money?
answer:
Pay less, earn more returnsJupiter doesn’t charge any hidden commissions of 1.5% over and above your investment
                amount like other regular funds.Jupiter doesn’t charge Penalties of up to Rs 750 that other banks charge in case you miss
                a SIP because of insufficient balance in your accountEasy investingSince your Jupiter App is also your investing app:- Jupiter doesn’t charge any hidden commissions of 1.5% over and above your investment amount like other
                regular funds.- Jupiter doesn’t charge Penalties of up to Rs 750 that other banks charge in case you miss a SIP
                because of insufficient balance in your accountEasy investing- No-Penalty SIP - If you’re ever running low on money in your Jupiter account, we will auto-skip your
                SIP. This way, there are no Penalty Charges to be paid- One-click SIPs. None of the filling in paperwork and putting down your signature on formsOn-Click cancel for any SIP. No questions asked

question: What are Direct Mutual Funds which Jupiter provides?
answer:
Direct Mutual Funds are Mutual Funds with Zero Commissions or Brokerage charges. They offer up to 1.5% extra
            returns compared to other Mutual Funds

question: Why should I invest in Mutual Funds?
answer: You can invest in Mutual funds as:You can save upto Rs 46,800 in your taxes every year.Your invested money compounds generating more money for you each year.You learn to save money for your future and build financial discipline

question: Are Mutual Funds regulated?
answer:
Mutual Fund companies are regulated by Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). SEBI falls under the
            control of the Ministry of Finance of India.

question: I don’t know what Mutual Funds to invest in. What do I do?
answer:
To start investing, its important to know why you're investing. To help you with this, we've created Mutual
            Funds collections to get you started - :- High Growth- Tax Saving Funds- Better than FD- Low cost index funds- SIP with 500.Here you will find Mutual Funds most relevant to your investment objectives

question: What is the smallest amount I can invest in Mutual Funds?
answer: You can start investing in Mutual Funds with as little as Rs. 500We've put together a Collection containing all Mutual Funds where you can start investing with Rs 500.

question: Is investing in Mutual Funds difficult?
answer: Investing in Mutual Funds is a breeze on Jupiter. All you need to do is:- Pick a Mutual Fund of your choice or select one from our curated “Collections”- Choose between making a “SIP” or “One Time investment”- Swipe to pay!- That’s it! You’ve made your Mutual Fund investment

question: How long does it take to get started with Mutual Funds on Jupiter?
answer: If you’re a verified user on the Jupiter app, you can make your investment in under 5 minutes

question: I’ve never been charged a Penalty before. Why should I choose No-Penalty SIPs?
answer:
Its amazing that you’ve never been charged a Penalty. This shows you have financial discipline. Investing
            with No-Penalty SIP gives you a sense of freedom. So if ever you have an emergency or want to use your money
            for another cause, you can simply tap to skip your SIP. No Penalty Charges. No questions asked. The choice
            rests with you!

question: How is Jupiter not charging the Rs. 250-750 Penalty? Is there any catch or fine-print?
answer:
When your SIP autopay mandate fails due to insufficient balance, you have to pay a penalty. AMCs don’t
            charge this penalty – banks do. Each bank would have their own penalty charge for not maintaining sufficient
            funds for the Electronic Clearing Service (ECS) mandate to go through. This penalty ranges from 250-750. At
            Jupiter, because you bank and invest on the same app, we smartly pause your SIP for the current month when
            your Jupiter balance is low. No charges, ever

question: Do you mean I don’t get same day’s NAV elsewhere?
answer:
Most Mutual Fund investment platforms may take a few working days to allocate units after you place an
            order. During this time the NAV can change. On Jupiter, you’re allotted units as per the NAV you see on the
            app (if you invest before 2 PM on working days).

question: What is Digital Gold on Jupiter?
answer:
Digital Gold on Jupiter allows you to buy and sell 24K gold online at live market prices, starting from as
            low as ₹10. It’s 100% digital and secure with no making charges.

question: How is my Digital Gold stored?
answer:
Every gram of Digital Gold you purchase is stored as 24K physical Gold in lifetime-free vaults by our
            trusted partners.

question: Can I start investing in Gold with just ₹10?
answer:
Yes, you can purchase 24K Digital Gold with just ₹10 or more. You can either make a one-time investment or
            invest regularly with daily, weekly, and monthly SIPs.

question: Can I sell my Digital Gold anytime?
answer: Yes, you can instantly sell your Digital Gold at live market prices from the Jupiter app.

question: Can I get physical delivery of the gold?
answer: Currently, Jupiter offers only digital storage of gold. Physical delivery is not available.

question: How is the price of Digital Gold determined?
answer: Prices are updated live and reflect the current market rate of 24K gold with no making charges.

question: Why should I invest in Digital Gold?
answer:
Digital Gold lets you invest in 24K pure gold without worrying about storage or safety. Unlike traditional
            options, you can start small, track your gold value in real time, and sell it anytime you want. It’s a smart
            way to grow your savings and with Jupiter, the process is completely digital.

question: Can I set up automatic investments in Digital Gold?
answer:
Yes, you can set up a daily, weekly, or monthly SIP to auto-invest in Digital Gold. You can also set up
            Magic Spends, a feature exclusively on Jupiter, to auto-invest in Gold every time you spend.

question: Why FlexiFD?
answer: Trusted by30 Lakh+IndiansFlexiFD has let me set aside my money without the stress of lock-inNathanFlexiFD has given me more control over my savings than anything else!RaviThe freedom to withdraw money anytime has been a game-changer for me!Suman

question: How do I earn Jewels on Jupiter?
answer: You earn Jewels when you spend using Jupiter—whether it’s with UPI, your debit card, or linked credit cards.5 Jewels = 1 Rupee

question: What can I redeem Jewels for?
answer: You can choose from the following loan options:Digital GoldCash creditsGift vouchersBill paymentsCredit card discounts

question: How fast can I redeem Jewels on Jupiter?
answer:
Yes, you can redeem the Jewels instantly. You can convert them to cash, gold, vouchers or use them to get
            discounts on bill payments.

question:
Do I get extra rewards with
            linked accounts or cards?
answer: Yes! For example:PRO Savings Account users get 1% cashbackEdge CSB Bank RuPay Card users get 2% cashbackLinking any RuPay credit card earns you up to 2% cashback on UPI and spends

question: Do the earned Jewels expire?
answer:
Your Jewels are safe and redeemable directly on the Jupiter app. Expiry terms, if any, are clearly shown
            under your rewards dashboard.

question: What’s Jupiter about?
answer: For most digitally native Indians,managing money comes withhidden fees, jargon and stress.

question: What is NPCI?
answer: NPCI is an authorized payment system operator by RBI.  NPCI owns and operates UPI payment system.

question: What is PSP bank?
answer: PSP is the banking company authorized to act as a Payment Service Provider (PSP) under the UPI framework. PSP engages the TPAP to provide UPI services to the end-user customers.

question: What is TPAPs?
answer: Third Party Application Provider (TPAP) is an entity that provides the UPI compliant app(s) to the end-user customers to facilitate UPI based payment transactions.

question: What is Customer’s Bank?
answer: The Bank where the end-user customer maintains his/her account and has linked the account for the purpose of debiting/crediting the payment transactions made through UPI.

question: Who is End User Customer?
answer: The end-user customer is the individual who uses UPI payment facility to send and receive payments.

question: 1.  Who can use the NPS calculator?
answer: Anyone eligible to invest in NPS can use the calculator. Presently, Indians between the age of 18 and 60 years can contribute to the scheme. If you belong to the group, the calculator will help you instantly get an idea about the potential returns.

question: 2. What does the calculator show?
answer: Once you input the investment amount, age, expected rate of return, and other required information, the calculator will reflect the following four things.

question: 1.  How does the PPF calculator help?
answer: The PPF interest calculator is an online tool that helps determine how much profit you can generate by investing in PPF. Once you enter the investment amount, frequency, and tenure on the calculator, it will show you the amount of interest and total returns you will earn at maturity.

question: 2. Is the PPF calculator free?
answer: Yes, the calculator is free of cost, and there is no limit to how many times you can use it.

question: 3. How accurate is the PPF calculator?
answer: The calculator is an automated tool that uses the data provided by you to determine the maturity amount with 100% accuracy. The possibility of error is nil as the process is computerized.

question: 4. Is it possible to use the PPF calculator for an investment tenure of more than 15 years?
answer: The calculator has the option to choose an investment tenure between 15 and 70 years. If you want to continue investing after the initial lock-in period of 15 years, select the tenure accordingly. The calculator will display the estimated maturity amount based on the information provided by you.

question: 5. Why is there no option to provide the interest rate on the PPF calculator?
answer: PPF interest rates are determined by the Central Government at the beginning of every quarter. These are based on the average government bond yield in the last three months. The calculator automatically uses the latest rate of interest to provide the most up-to-date result. The current PPF interest rate for the April to June 2021 period is 7.1%.

question: What Is Salary Calculator?
answer: A take home salary/ in-hand calculator is an automated tool that helps you figure out your net salary after taxation. It also considers all the bonuses and deductions applicable. You must provide the gross salary and total bonus.

question: How to use a Salary Calculator?
answer: The process to use the salary calculator is quick and simple. Follow the three steps given below:

question: How to Calculate Monthly Take-Home Salary?
answer: Your monthly take-home salary is the amount that remains after subtracting the total deductions from gross pay.

question: How to Calculate Take Home Salary After Taxes?
answer: Everyone is curious what their take home pay will be once an organization decides the appraisal for the employee or share the new offer letter to a candidate. Let's breakdown how to calculate take home pay after the taxation.

question: How to Calculate Gratuity?
answer: Gratuity = (Basic Salary + Dearness Allowance) × 15 × (Years of Service) ÷ 26

question: 1.  What do I need to know to use the salary calculator?
answer: You should only know your gross salary and total bonus. Once you provide the data, the calculator will show the other relevant salary components in no time.

question: 2. How does the calculator determine the basic pay?
answer: It calculates the basic salary as a percentage of the CTC. You may change the percentage based on your requirements.

question: 3.  Can I find the TDS on the salary calculator?
answer: You cannot find theTDS on salarycalculator separately. You can easily find the TDS amount on your salary slip.

question: 4. Does the salary calculator show the deductions?
answer: Yes, the calculator shows the professional tax and provident fund deductions. It also reflects the total deductions.

question: 5. How much gratuity amount is deducted from salary?
answer: Most companies deduct around 4.81% of your salary (This includes your Basic salary +Dearness Allowance)

question: 6. What are the main components of salary structure?
answer: The main components of a salary structure include basic salary, HRA, DA, conveyance, medical allowance, special allowance, provident fund, professional tax, and bonuses.

question: 7. Does CTC include PF?
answer: Yes, CTC (Cost to Company) typically includes PF (Provident Fund) as part of the total compensation package, along with other benefits like bonuses and allowances.

question: 8. How do I know the break-up of my salary?
answer: You can find the breakdown of your salary on your salary slip or pay statement, which typically lists components like basic salary, allowances, deductions (e.g., PF and taxes), and bonuses. Your HR department can also provide detailed information.

question: 1. How are Personal Loan EMIs paid?
answer: Personal Loan EMIs are typically paid through auto-debit from your linked bank account.

question: 2. How can I reduce my Personal Loan EMI?
answer: You can reduce your EMI by increasing the loan tenure or by making prepayments.

question: 3. Is collateral required for a Personal Loan?
answer: No, Personal Loans are generally unsecured loans, meaning they don't require collateral.

question: 4. Does the EMI amount remain fixed throughout the loan tenure?
answer: Yes, the EMI amount remains fixed throughout the loan tenure.

question: 5. How can I avail a Personal Loan with low interest rates on Jupiter?
answer: If you have a Salary Account on the Jupiter App, your eligibility for a Personal Loan with low interest rates will depend on factors like your credit score and account history. If you don't have a Salary Account, you can increase your chances by having two continuous salary credits.

question: 6. What is the eligibility for a Personal Loan on Jupiter?
answer: Eligibility for a Personal Loan on Jupiter depends on factors like your credit score, income, and account history. Please refer to our main eligibility page for more details.

question: 7. What is the Personal Loan interest rate on Jupiter?
answer: The Personal Loan interest rate on Jupiter ranges from 16% to 28% Annual Percentage Rate. The actual rate varies based on multiple factors. Please reach out to the Jupiter team for more information. Processing fees are up to 3% + GST.

question: What is an EMI calculator?
answer: Most loans are repaid in equated monthly installments (EMIs). Knowing the approximate EMI amount you will have to pay can help you plan your finances well.

question: How is an Online EMI calculator used?
answer: You can easily find an EMI calculator online that not only provides instant results but also shows the breakdown between principal repayment and interest amount paid over the loan duration.

question: What are the benefits of using an EMI calculator?
answer: Before you avail of a loan, whether secured or unsecured, having an idea of the approximate monthly installment is beneficial.

question: What types of loans can you use the EMI calculator for?
answer: You can use these online EMI calculators for all types of credit facilities, which include personal, automobile, and home loans.

question: What is comprised in the EMI?
answer: Some portion of the EMI is used towards the principal repayment and the balance towards the interest.

question: What happens if the interest rate increases or decreases during the loan duration?
answer: If your loan is based on a floating interest rate and it decreases during the tenure, a higher portion of the EMI is used towards principal repayment, thereby reducing the loan tenure.

question: How to use an EMI calculator?
answer: To use a calculator, you need to input the loan amount in Rupees, the rate of interest in percentage, and the loan duration in years or months, or both.

question: Is the installment amount calculated using the EMI calculator the same as that determined by the lender?
answer: When the lender approves your loan application, the exact EMI may vary slightly from the one calculated using an online calculator. The difference may arise due to the actual rate of interest charged by the lender and the processing fees levied.

question: Can the EMI amount change over the loan tenure?
answer: Lenders offer a floating rate of interest for home and business loans and any change in the interest rate can impact your EMI.

question: When do you have to pay the EMI after availing of a loan?
answer: The lender will provide an EMI schedule at the time of disbursement. The EMI is due on a particular date of the month, which is pre-determined when you receive the loan approval.

question: What happens if you do not pay the EMI on time?
answer: If you miss an EMI payment on the due date, the lender may levy a late payment fee. Additionally, it is reflected on your credit history and can negatively impact your credit score.

question: Is it good to pre-close the loan before the end of its duration?
answer: Lenders may charge a prepayment penalty if you repay the entire amount before its due date. Pre-closure may also negatively impact your credit score.

question: What factors affect the EMI amount?
answer: Before you avail of a loan, having an idea of the approximate EMI can help you understand the approximate monthly outflow and allow you to plan your finances to avoid any liquidity crunch. The following factors impact the EMI amount.

question: Are home, car, and personal loan calculators the same?
answer: Most online calculators use the loan amount, rate of interest, and duration to calculate the EMI. However, some calculators may restrict the total loan amount depending on the type of loan you are applying for.

question: What is a Home Loan EMI Calculator?
answer: A Home Loan EMI Calculator is a convenient online tool designed to help you calculate your monthly home loan payments. This home loan prepayment calculator acts as your personal loan advisor, helping you estimate the exact amount you'll need to pay each month (EMI) to repay your home loan. By using this calculator, you can:

question: How to Use a Home Loan Calculator? Step-by-Step Guide
answer: Using a home loan EMI calculator is easy and can help you get a quick estimate of your monthly loan payments. Here's how it works:

question: How to Calculate Home Loan EMI?
answer: EMIsare calculated using a formula that considers three key factors:

question: What Factors Affect Your Home Loan EMI?
answer: Loan Amount (Principal):The total sum you borrow for your home purchase. A larger loan amount translates to a higher EMI payment.Interest Rate:The interest rate offered by the bank determines how much you pay in addition to the loan amount. A higher interest rate translates to a higher EMI.Processing Fee:The processing fee covers the cost of reviewing your home loan application. It's usually a percentage of the loan amount or set as a fixed fee.Loan Tenure:Longer loan tenures result in lower monthly EMIs but higher total interest paid over time. Shorter tenures lead to higher monthly EMIs but lower total interest.Prepayments:Making extra payments towards your home loan can significantly impact your EMIs. These prepayments reduce the outstanding principal amount, leading to lower EMIs.

question: What are Flexible and Fixed Home Loan EMIs?
answer: While most home loan EMIs are fixed throughout the loan term, they might change in some situations:

question: What is a home loan amortisation schedule?
answer: A home loan amortisation schedule is a detailed breakdown of your monthly loan payments over the entire loan term, showing how much goes towards interest and how much towards reducing the principal loan amount.

question: Is a home loan EMI calculator accurate?
answer: Home Loan EMI calculators are generally very accurate but should be used as an estimate. The actual EMI might differ slightly due to factors like rounding and processing fees.

question: Is it free to use Jupiter's home loan EMI Calculator?
answer: Yes, Jupiter's Home Loan EMI Calculator is completely free to use.

question: Is GST applicable to home loan EMI?
answer: No, GST is not applicable to the EMI amount itself. However, GST might be levied on processing fees or other charges associated with the home loan.

question: What is the eligibility criteria for getting a home loan?
answer: Eligibility criteria vary by lender but generally consider your income, credit score, employment status, and down payment amount.

question: What happens if the home loan EMI is not paid?
answer: Late or missed EMI payments can damage your credit score and lead to late payment penalties. In severe cases, the lender may repossess the property.

question: Does home loan EMI change with the increase in home loan interest rates?
answer: No, your EMI amount typically remains fixed for the entire loan term with a fixed interest rate. However, with adjustable-rate mortgages, your EMI can fluctuate if the interest rate changes.

question: What are the different types of home loans available?
answer: Several home loan types exist, including fixed-rate, adjustable-rate, and special programs for first-time homebuyers.

question: Is it possible to change my home loan EMI amount during the loan tenure?
answer: Yes, your EMI can change in some cases, such as with adjustable-rate mortgages or if you make additional principal payments.

question: What are the tax benefits of paying home loan EMIs?
answer: In many countries, you can deduct a portion of the interest paid on your home loan from your taxable income.

question: What is the EMI for a 20 Lakh home loan?
answer: Use a home loan EMI calculator to estimate your EMI for a specific loan amount, interest rate, and loan term.

question: How to pay extra EMI for home loan?
answer: Most lenders allow you to make additional principal payments towards your home loan. Contact your lender to learn about their specific process.

question: When does home loan EMI start for under construction property?
answer: For under-construction properties, EMI payments often start after construction is complete and the property is ready for possession. There might be a pre-EMI interest charged during the construction phase.

question: Can I pay home Loan EMI through credit card?
answer: Generally, paying your home loan EMI through a credit card is not advisable due to high credit card interest rates. Additionally, not many lenders offer this option.

question: Can we stop home loan EMI for a few months?
answer: Most lenders don't offer the option to completely stop EMI payments. However, some might offer loan modification programs that could temporarily reduce your EMI amount.

question: How to reduce EMI of existing home loan?
answer: There areways to potentially reduce your EMI, such as refinancing your loan at a lower interest rate or making a larger down payment.

question: When does my home loan EMI start?
answer: The start of your EMI payments typically depends on the loan type and property status. For already constructed properties, EMIs usually begin one month after loan disbursal.

question: What is a pre-EMI interest on a home loan?
answer: Pre-EMI interest is the interest charged on the disbursed loan amount during the construction period of an under-construction property.

question: How does your home loan repayment work?
answer: Your home loan repayment consists of monthly payments that include both principal and interest. The portion towards principal increases and the interest portion decreases over time.

question: How much home loan am I eligible for?
answer: The maximum home loan amount you can qualify for depends on several factors, including your income, credit score, existing debts, and the lender's policies. Use a home loan eligibility calculator to get a starting estimate.

question: Are there any hidden fees associated with a home loan?
answer: While the base interest rate is crucial, there can be additional charges like processing fees, valuation charges, and legal and documentation charges.

question: How much is 10 lakh home loan EMI?
answer: The EMI for a loan amount of ₹ 10 lakh will be ₹7,867 for a tenure of 30 years OR ₹12,533 for 10 years at 8.75% rate of interest. An EMI on a loan amount of Rs. 10 Lakh will be dependent on the number of  years the loan is taken for and the rate of interest set by the Banks or financial institutions.

question: How much is 20 lakh home loan EMI?
answer: The EMI for a loan amount of ₹ 20 lakh will be ₹15,734 for a tenure of 30 years OR ₹25,065 for 10 years at 8.75% rate of interest. An EMI on a loan amount of Rs. 20 Lakh will be dependent on the number of  years the loan is taken for and the rate of interest set by the Banks or financial institutions.

question: How much is 30 lakh home loan EMI?
answer: The EMI for a loan amount of ₹ 30 lakh will be ₹23,601 for a tenure of 30 years OR ₹37,598 for 10 years at 8.75% rate of interest. An EMI on a loan amount of Rs. 30 Lakh will be dependent on the number of  years the loan is taken for and the rate of interest set by the Banks or financial institutions.

question: How much is 40 lakh home loan EMI?
answer: The EMI for a loan amount of ₹ 40 lakh will be ₹31,468 for a tenure of 30 years OR ₹50,131 for 10 years at 8.75% rate of interest. An EMI on a loan amount of Rs. 40 Lakh will be dependent on the number of  years the loan is taken for and the rate of interest set by the Banks or financial institutions.

question: How much is 50 lakh home loan EMI?
answer: The EMI for a loan amount of ₹ 50 lakh will be ₹40,231 for a tenure of 30 years OR ₹62,663 for 10 years at 8.75% rate of interest. An EMI on a loan amount of Rs. 50 Lakh will be dependent on the number of  years the loan is taken for and the rate of interest set by the Banks or financial institutions.

question: What is Credit Card EMI?
answer: A Credit Card EMI allows users to convert a large purchase made with a credit card into smaller, more manageable monthly installments. Instead of paying the full amount at once, you can chose to repay the amount in parts. Your bank will provide the feature to pay the amount back over a predefined tenure with applicable interest rate.

question: What is a Credit Card EMI Calculator?
answer: A Credit Card EMI Calculator is a tool that helps you figure out how much you will pay each month if you convert a large purchase on your credit card into EMIs (Equated Monthly Installments).

question: How to add a nominee for mutual funds online?
answer: You need not visit the website of each and every mutual fund house. Instead, you can add nominees on Karvy (KFintech), CAMS, and MFCentral websites. Different brokers have different procedures for updating nominee details.

question: What is a RuPay Credit Card?
answer: A RuPay Credit Card is a domestic payment card introduced by the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI). It offers secure and seamless transactions at various online and offline platforms, with acceptance at ATMs and retail outlets across India. RuPay cards are designed to meet the diverse needs of Indian consumers, offering benefits such as lower processing fees and faster transaction speeds.

question: What is the interest rate on EPF for the financial year 2024-25?
answer: The EPF interest rate for the year 2024 is 8.25% per annum. While it is calculated monthly, the interest rate is transferred to the provident fund account only at the end of the financial year, 31st March.

question: What is the Law of Diminishing Marginal Utility (DMU)?
answer: The Law of Diminishing Marginal Utility states that as a person consumes more of a good or service, the additional satisfaction (or utility) they derive from each additional unit decreases.

question: Which is the best bank for a salary account in 2024?
answer: As of 2024, the salary account offered through the Jupiter App, backed by Federal Bank, stands out as one of the top options. It features an On-Demand Salary option, allowing you to access your salary whenever you need it, rather than waiting until the end of the month. This can be really helpful for those who want flexibility in managing their finances. Plus, it comes with free health insurance coverage up to ₹2,00,000 and gives you 1% cashback on all your purchases, making it a solid choice for anyone looking for a convenient and rewarding salary account.

question: What Is Dearness Allowance for Pensioners?
answer: Whenever there is a revision in the salary of public sector employees, a corresponding adjustment is made to the pension received by retired employees. As a result, the dearness allowance provided to retired employees is directly influenced by this revision.

question: Which is the best platform to buy digital gold?
answer: Jupiter Money is the best platform for online gold. It offers a user-friendly interface, seamless transactions, and competitive prices for buying and selling gold. Additionally, Jupiter Money provides secure storage options, transparent pricing, and excellent customer service. Overall, it offers a comprehensive and reliable solution for individuals looking to invest in gold online.

question: What is a savings account for women?
answer: Women’s savings account caters to banking and investment facilities for women. It comes with unique features and benefits for her. These include lower loan interest rates, waving off DEMAT account charges and special discounts.

question: What is a savings bank account if there is no need for it?
answer: Savings Account holds great importance in the Indian banking system. It works like an E-locker that stores your funds and withdraw them anytime. It also offers a compound interest on all your savings. It also facilitates online transactions, cash withdrawals and much more. You can even make payments and pay bills through your savings account.

question: Which credit card is best for airport lounge access?
answer: Choosing the right credit card for airport lounge access depends on your travel frequency and spending habits. Consider factors like annual fee, lounge network, complimentary visits, and additional benefits.

question: Is it possible to build a credit history without getting a credit card?
answer: Yes, it is possible to build a strong credit history without owning a credit card. Several alternative methods can help you build a positive credit profile. These include taking out small loans and repaying them on time, using secured credit cards, and ensuring timely payment of utility bills and rent.

question: Which credit card is best for movie tickets?
answer: There are so many credit cards in the market that offer excellent rewards on movie ticket purchases. Some of them are Axis My Zone Credit Card, SBI Card Prime, and BookMyShow RBL Play Credit Card. Make sure you check all the benefits of the card along with the terms and conditions before applying for it.

question: Can I use my RuPay fuel credit card for other purchases besides fuel?
answer: Yes, you can use your RuPay fuel credit card for a variety of purchases, just like you would with any other credit card. However, keep in mind that the special benefits and rewards offered for fuel transactions may not be available for other types of purchases.

question: Can I get a personal loan with a 500 credit score?
answer: You can definitely get a personal loan with a credit score of 500, but be prepared for limited options. Traditional lenders usually shy away from such low scores, so it’s worth looking into loan apps that specifically cater to those with lower credit.

question: Is credit card good or bad, and why?
answer: Credit cards are an excellent financial tool to manage your budget and expenses, build a credit score, and get easy credit. However, anything in excess is harmful. So don’t overuse your credit cards and use them optimally to take advantage of them.

question: Can someone else take out a loan using my PAN card?
answer: No, lenders have strict verification processes to prevent this. But if someone somehow manages to misuse your PAN details, they could try to take out a loan in your name. It’s rare but not impossible. This is why it’s so important to keep an eye on your credit report. If you spot any loans you didn’t take, report it right away.

question: What is the longest tenure for a personal loan?
answer: Most lenders offer personal loans for up to 5 years, though some may go up to 7 years, depending on your financial profile and the lender’s terms.

question: Is a consumer loan the same as a retail loan?
answer: Yes, consumer loans belong to the larger group of retail loans aimed at individuals.
